agency.compaction-keep-size.description: keep as many indices before compaction point

agency.compaction-step-size.description: step size between state machine compactions

agency.disaster-recovery-id.description: allows for specification of the id for this agent; dangerous option for disaster recover only!

agency.election-timeout-max.description: maximum timeout before an agent calls for new election (in seconds)

agency.election-timeout-min.description: minimum timeout before an agent calls for new election (in seconds)

agency.max-append-size.description: maximum size of appendEntries document (# log entries)

agency.my-address.description: which address to advertise to the outside

agency.supervision-grace-period.description: supervision time, after which a server is considered to have failed (in seconds)

agency.supervision-ok-threshold.description: supervision time, after which a server is considered to be bad [s]

agency.wait-for-sync.description: wait for hard disk syncs on every persistence call (required in production)

arangosearch.commit-threads.description: upper limit to the allowed number of commit threads (0 == autodetect)

arangosearch.commit-threads-idle.description: upper limit to the allowed number of idle threads to use for commit tasks (0 == autodetect)

arangosearch.consolidation-threads.description: upper limit to the allowed number of consolidation threads (0 == autodetect)

arangosearch.consolidation-threads-idle.description: upper limit to the allowed number of idle threads to use for consolidation tasks (0 == autodetect)

arangosearch.threads.description: the exact number of threads to use for asynchronous tasks (0 == autodetect)

arangosearch.threads-limit.description: upper limit to the autodetected number of threads to use for asynchronous tasks (0 == use default)

audit.max-entry-length.description: maximum length of a log entry (in bytes)

audit.queue.description: queue audit log message before writing them out (can reduce latency)

audit.write-log-level.description: add the log level of the audit event (TRACE, INFO, DEBUG, WARNING, ERROR) to audit log messages

backup.api-enabled.description: whether the backup api is enabled (true) or not (false), or only enabled for superuser JWT (jwt)

backup.local-path-prefix.description: this option restricts any backup target to a given path prefix

cluster.api-jwt-policy.description: access permissions required for accessing /_admin/cluster REST APIs (jwt-all = JWT required to access all operations, jwt-write = JWT required for post/put/delete operations, jwt-compat = 3.7 compatibility mode)

cluster.create-waits-for-sync-replicatio.description: active coordinator will wait for all replicas to create collection

cluster.default-replication-factor.description: default replication factor for non-system collections

cluster.force-one-shard.description: force one-shard mode for all new collections

cluster.index-create-timeout.description: amount of time (in seconds) the coordinator will wait for an index to be created before giving up

cluster.max-number-of-move-shards.description: number of shards to be moved per rebalance operation. If value = 0, no shards will be moved

cluster.max-number-of-shards.description: maximum number of shards when creating new collections (0 = unrestricted)

cluster.max-replication-factor.description: maximum replication factor for new collections (0 = unrestricted)

cluster.min-replication-factor.description: minimum replication factor for new collections

cluster.my-advertised-endpoint.description: this server's advertised endpoint (e.g. external IP address or load balancer, optional)

cluster.require-persisted-id.description: if set to true, then the instance will only start if a UUID file is found in the database on startup. Setting this option will make sure the instance is started using an already existing database directory and not a new one. For the first start, the UUID file must either be created manually or the option must be set to false for the initial startup

cluster.resign-leadership-on-shutdown.description: create resign leader ship job for this dbsever on shutdown

cluster.shard-synchronization-attempt-ti.description: timeout (in seconds) for every shard synchronization attempt. running into the timeout will not lead to a synchronization failure, but will continue the synchronization shortly after. setting a timeout can help to split the replication of large shards into smaller chunks and release snapshots on the leader earlier

cluster.synchronous-replication-timeout-.description: all synchronous replication timeouts are multiplied by this factor
all synchronous replication timeouts will be at most this value (in seconds)
all synchronous replication timeouts will be at least this value (in seconds)
all synchronous replication timeouts are increased by this amount per 4096 bytes (in seconds)

cluster.system-replication-factor.description: default replication factor for system collections

cluster.upgrade.description: perform a cluster upgrade if necessary (auto = perform upgrade and shut down only if `--database.auto-upgrade true` is set, disable = never perform upgrade, force = always perform an upgrade and shut down, online = always perform an upgrade but don't shut down)

cluster.write-concern.description: write concern used for writes to new collections

daemon.description: background the server, running it as daemon

database.auto-upgrade.description: perform a database upgrade if necessary

database.check-version.description: checks the versions of the database and exit

database.extended-names-databases.description: Allow most UTF-8 characters in database names. Once in use, this option cannot be turned off again.

database.force-sync-properties.description: force syncing of collection properties to disk, will use waitForSync value of collection when turned off

database.ignore-datafile-errors.description: load collections even if datafiles may contain errors

database.io-heartbeat.description: perform IO heartbeat to test underlying volume

database.required-directory-state.description: required state of database directory at startup (non-existing: database directory must not exist, existing: database directory must exist, empty: database directory must exist but be empty, populated: database directory must exist and contain specific files already, any: any state allowed)

database.restore-admin.description: resets the admin users and sets a new password

database.wait-for-sync.description: default wait-for-sync behavior, can be overwritten when creating a collection

default-language.description: An ISO-639 language code. This option can only be set once, when initializing the database.

default-language-check.description: Check if `--icu-language` / `--default-language` matches the stored language.

define.description: Define a value for a `@key@` entry in the configuration file using the syntax `"key=value"`.

dump-options.description: dump configuration options in JSON format

encryption.key-generator.description: program providing the encryption key on stdout. If set, encryption will be enabled.

encryption.keyfile.description: file containing the encryption key. If set, encryption will be enabled.

foxx.allow-install-from-remote.description: allow installing Foxx apps from remote URLs other than Github

foxx.force-update-on-startup.description: ensure all Foxx services are synchronized before completeing the boot sequence

foxx.queues-poll-interval.description: poll interval (in seconds) for Foxx queue manager

foxx.store.description: enables Foxx store in web interface

gid.description: switch to group-id after reading config files

http.allow-method-override.description: allow HTTP method override using special headers

http.hide-product-header.description: do not expose "Server: ArangoDB" header in HTTP responses

http.permanently-redirect-root.description: if true, use a permanent redirect. If false, use a temporary

http.return-queue-time-header.description: If true, return the `x-arango-queue-time-seconds` header in responses.

http.trusted-origin.description: trusted origin URLs for CORS requests with credentials

icu-language.description: An ICU locale ID to set a language and optionally additional properties that affect string comparisons and sorting. This option can only be set once, when initializing the database.

javascript.allow-admin-execute.description: for testing purposes allow '_admin/execute', NEVER enable on production

javascript.allow-external-process-contro.description: allow execution and control of external processes from within JavaScript actions

javascript.allow-port-testing.description: allow testing of ports from within JavaScript actions

javascript.copy-installation.description: copy contents of 'javascript.startup-directory' on first start

javascript.endpoints-allowlist.description: endpoints that can be connected to via @arangodb/request module in JavaScript actions

javascript.endpoints-denylist.description: endpoints that cannot be connected to via @arangodb/request module in JavaScript actions (if not in allowlist)

javascript.environment-variables-allowli.description: environment variables that will be accessible in JavaScript

javascript.environment-variables-denylis.description: environment variables that will be inaccessible in JavaScript (if not in allowlist)

javascript.files-allowlist.description: filesystem paths that will be accessible from within JavaScript actions

javascript.gc-frequency.description: JavaScript time-based garbage collection frequency (each x seconds)

javascript.gc-interval.description: JavaScript request-based garbage collection interval (each x requests)

javascript.harden.description: disables access to JavaScript functions in the internal module: getPid() and logLevel()

javascript.startup-directory.description: path to the directory containing JavaScript startup scripts

javascript.startup-options-allowlist.description: startup options whose names match this regular expression will be allowed and exposed to JavaScript

javascript.startup-options-denylist.description: startup options whose names match this regular expression will not be exposed (if not in allowlist) to JavaScript actions

javascript.v8-contexts.description: maximum number of V8 contexts that are created for executing JavaScript actions

javascript.v8-contexts-max-age.description: maximum age for each V8 context (in seconds) before it is disposed

javascript.v8-contexts-max-invocations.description: maximum number of invocations for each V8 context before it is disposed

javascript.v8-contexts-minimum.description: minimum number of V8 contexts that keep available for executing JavaScript actions

ldap.allow-offline.description: If a refresh attempt fails to connect to the LDAP server, continue with the cached authentication data

ldap.async-connect.description: Whether or not the connection to the LDAP library will be done asynchronously

ldap.debug.description: Turn on internal OpenLDAP library output (warning: will print to stdout)

ldap.network-timeout.description: Timeout value (in seconds) after which network operations following the initial connection return in case of no activity (a value of 0 means default timeout)

ldap.prefix.description: ldap prefix, eg. uid= xor dn= xor cn=

ldap.referrals.description: Whether or not the LDAP library should implicitly chase referrals

ldap.refresh-rate.description: Refresh user settings after this time (in seconds)

ldap.responsible-for.description: A file of usernames this provider is responsible for. If empty, it will be responsible for all users

ldap.restart.description: Whether or not the LDAP library should implicitly restart connections

ldap.retries.description: Number of tries to attempt connecting to the LDAP server. Setting it to values greater than one will retry connecting in case the LDAP server is unavailable or denies the connection

ldap.roles-attribute-name.description: ldap attributename where the role are located.

ldap.roles-exclude.description: Regexp to exclude groups. Leave empty to exclude none.

ldap.roles-include.description: Regexp to include groups. Leave empty to include all.

ldap.roles-search.description: ldap search for roles; '{USER}' is replaced by the 'dn' of the user.

ldap.roles-transformation.description: Regexp to normalizer role name, e.g. '/^ *(.*[^ ]])*/$2/'

ldap.search-scope.description: ldap search scope, one of base, one, sub

ldap.serialize-timeout.description: Maximum amount of time (in seconds) that will be waited for the serialization mutex

ldap.serialized.description: Whether or not calls into the LDAP library should be serialized. This option can be used to work around thread-unsafe LDAP library functionality

ldap.timeout.description: Timeout value (in seconds) for synchronous LDAP API calls (a value of 0 means default timeout)

ldap.tls-cert-check-strategy.description: ldap tls cert check strategy, one of never, hard, demand, allow, try

ldap2.allow-offline.description: If a refresh attempt fails to connect to the LDAP server, continue with the cached authentication data

ldap2.async-connect.description: Whether or not the connection to the LDAP library will be done asynchronously

ldap2.debug.description: Turn on internal OpenLDAP library output (warning: will print to stdout)

ldap2.network-timeout.description: Timeout value (in seconds) after which network operations following the initial connection return in case of no activity (a value of 0 means default timeout)

ldap2.prefix.description: ldap prefix, eg. uid= xor dn= xor cn=

ldap2.referrals.description: Whether or not the LDAP library should implicitly chase referrals

ldap2.refresh-rate.description: Refresh user settings after this time (in seconds)

ldap2.responsible-for.description: A file of usernames this provider is responsible for. If empty, it will be responsible for all users

ldap2.restart.description: Whether or not the LDAP library should implicitly restart connections

ldap2.retries.description: Number of tries to attempt connecting to the LDAP server. Setting it to values greater than one will retry connecting in case the LDAP server is unavailable or denies the connection

ldap2.roles-attribute-name.description: ldap attributename where the role are located.

ldap2.roles-exclude.description: Regexp to exclude groups. Leave empty to exclude none.

ldap2.roles-include.description: Regexp to include groups. Leave empty to include all.

ldap2.roles-search.description: ldap search for roles; '{USER}' is replaced by the 'dn' of the user.

ldap2.roles-transformation.description: Regexp to normalizer role name, e.g. '/^ *(.*[^ ]])*/$2/'

ldap2.search-scope.description: ldap search scope, one of base, one, sub

ldap2.serialize-timeout.description: Maximum amount of time (in seconds) that will be waited for the serialization mutex

ldap2.serialized.description: Whether or not calls into the LDAP library should be serialized. This option can be used to work around thread-unsafe LDAP library functionality

ldap2.timeout.description: Timeout value (in seconds) for synchronous LDAP API calls (a value of 0 means default timeout)

ldap2.tls-cert-check-strategy.description: ldap tls cert check strategy, one of never, hard, demand, allow, try

log.description: the global or topic-specific log level

log.api-enabled.description: whether the log api is enabled (true) or not (false), or only enabled for superuser JWT (jwt)

log.file-group.description: group to use for new log file, user must be a member of this group

log.file-mode.description: mode to use for new log file, umask will be applied as well

log.force-direct.description: do not start a seperate thread for logging

log.foreground-tty.description: also log to tty if backgrounded

log.hostname.description: The hostname to use in log message. Leave empty for none, use "auto" to automatically determine a hostname.

log.in-memory.description: use in-memory log appender, which can be queried via the API and web interface

log.in-memory-level.description: use in-memory log appender only for this log level and higher

log.keep-logrotate.description: keep the old log file after receiving a sighup

log.level.description: the global or topic-specific log level

log.line-number.description: include the function name, file name and line number of the source code that issues the log message. Format: `[func@FileName.cpp:123]`

log.max-entry-length.description: maximum length of a log entry (in bytes)

log.output.description: log destination(s), e.g. file:///path/to/file (any '$PID' will be replaced with the process id)

log.prefix.description: prefix log message with this string

log.process.description: show process identifier (pid) in log message

log.request-parameters.description: include full URLs and HTTP request parameters in trace logs

log.shorten-filenames.description: shorten filenames in log output (use with --log.line-number)

log.structured-param.description: toggle usage of log category parameter in structured log messages

log.thread.description: show thread identifier in log message

log.thread-name.description: show thread name in log message

log.time-format.description: time format to use in logs

log.use-local-time.description: use local timezone instead of UTC

network.idle-connection-ttl.description: default time-to-live of idle connections for cluster-internal communication (in milliseconds)

network.io-threads.description: number of network IO threads for cluster-internal communication

network.max-open-connections.description: max open TCP connections for cluster-internal communication per endpoint

network.max-requests-in-flight.description: controls the number of internal requests that can be in flight at a given point in time

network.protocol.description: network protocol to use for cluster-internal communication

network.verify-hosts.description: verify hosts when using TLS in cluster-internal communication

pregel.max-parallelism.description: maximum parallelism usable in a Pregel job

pregel.memory-mapped-files.description: use memory mapped files for storing Pregel temporary data (as opposed to storing in RAM) if nothing is specifed in a Pregel job

pregel.memory-mapped-files-custom-path.description: Custom path for Pregel's temporary files. Only used if `--pregel.memory-mapped-files-location` is "custom".

pregel.min-parallelism.description: minimum parallelism usable in a Pregel job

pregel.parallelism.description: default parallelism to use in a Pregel job if none is specified

query.allow-collections-in-expressions.description: allow full collections to be used in AQL expressions

query.cache-entries.description: maximum number of results in query result cache per database

query.cache-entries-max-size.description: maximum cumulated size of results in query result cache per database

query.cache-entry-max-size.description: maximum size of an invidiual result entry in query result cache

query.cache-include-system-collections.description: whether or not to include system collection queries in the query result cache

query.cache-mode.description: Mode for the AQL query result cache. Can be "on", "off", or "demand".

query.fail-on-warning.description: whether AQL queries should fail with errors even for recoverable warnings

query.global-memory-limit.description: memory threshold for all AQL queries combined (in bytes, 0 = no limit)

query.max-nodes-per-callstack.description: maximum number execution nodes on the callstack before splitting the remaining nodes into a separate thread

query.max-parallelism.description: maximum number of threads to use for a single query; actual query execution may use less depending on various factors

query.max-runtime.description: runtime threshold for AQL queries (in seconds, 0 = no limit)

query.memory-limit.description: memory threshold per AQL query (in bytes, 0 = no limit)

query.memory-limit-override.description: allow increasing per-query memory limits for individual queries

query.optimizer-max-plans.description: maximum number of query plans to create for a query

query.optimizer-rules.description: Enable or disable specific optimizer rules by default. Specify the rule name prefixed with `-` for disabling, or `+` for enabling.

query.parallelize-gather-writes.description: enable write parallelization for gather nodes

query.registry-ttl.description: default time-to-live of cursors and query snippets (in seconds); if <= 0, value will default to 30 for single-server instances or 600 for coordinator instances

query.require-with.description: whether AQL queries should require the `WITH collection-name` clause even on single servers (enable this to remove this behavior difference between single server and cluster)

query.slow-streaming-threshold.description: threshold for slow streaming AQL queries (in seconds)

query.slow-threshold.description: threshold for slow AQL queries (in seconds)

query.tracking-with-bindvars.description: whether to track bind vars with AQL queries

query.tracking-with-datasources.description: whether to track data sources with AQL queries

query.tracking-with-querystring.description: whether to track the query string

random.generator.description: random number generator to use (1 = MERSENNE, 2 = RANDOM, 3 = URANDOM, 4 = COMBINED (not for Windows), 5 = WinCrypt (Windows only)

rclone.executable.description: rclone executable used for up and download of backups

replication.auto-start.description: switch to enable or disable the automatic start of replication appliers

replication.connect-timeout.description: Default timeout value for replication connection attempts (in seconds)

replication.max-parallel-tailing-invocat.description: Maximum number of concurrently allowed WAL tailing invocations (0 = unlimited)

replication.quick-keys-limit.description: Limit at which 'quick' calls to the replication keys API return only the document count for second run

replication.request-timeout.description: Default timeout value for replication requests (in seconds)

replication.sync-by-revision.description: Whether to use the newer revision-based replication protocol

rocksdb.allow-fallocate.description: if true, allow RocksDB to use fallocate calls. if false, fallocate calls are bypassed

rocksdb.block-align-data-blocks.description: if true, aligns data blocks on lesser of page size and block size

rocksdb.block-cache-shard-bits.description: number of shard bits to use for block cache (use -1 for default value)

rocksdb.block-cache-size.description: size of block cache in bytes

rocksdb.cache-index-and-filter-blocks.description: if turned on, the RocksDB block cache quota will also include RocksDB memtable sizes

rocksdb.cache-index-and-filter-blocks-wi.description: if true and `--rocksdb.cache-index-and-filter-blocks` is also true, cache index and filter blocks with high priority, making index and filter blocks be less likely to be evicted than data blocks

rocksdb.checksum-type.description: checksum type to use for table files

rocksdb.compaction-read-ahead-size.description: if non-zero, we perform bigger reads when doing compaction. If you're running RocksDB on spinning disks, you should set this to at least 2MB. that way RocksDB's compaction is doing sequential instead of random reads.

rocksdb.compaction-style.description: compaction style which is used to pick the next file(s) to be compacted

rocksdb.compression-type.description: compression algorithm to use within RocksDB

rocksdb.create-sha-files.description: enable generation of sha256 files for each .sst file

rocksdb.debug-logging.description: true to enable rocksdb debug logging

rocksdb.delayed-write-rate.description: limited write rate to DB (in bytes per second) if we are writing to the last mem-table allowed and we allow more than 3 mem-tables, or if we have surpassed a certain number of level-0 files and need to slowdown writes

rocksdb.dynamic-level-bytes.description: if true, determine the number of bytes for each level dynamically to minimize space amplification

rocksdb.enable-pipelined-write.description: if true, use a two stage write queue for WAL writes and memtable writes

rocksdb.enable-statistics.description: whether or not RocksDB statistics should be turned on

rocksdb.encryption-hardware-acceleration.description: use Intel intrinsics-based encryption, requiring a CPU with the AES-NI instruction set. If turned off, then OpenSSL is used, which may use hardware-accelarated encryption too.

rocksdb.encryption-key-generator.description: program providing the encryption key on stdout. If set, encryption will be enabled.

rocksdb.encryption-keyfile.description: file containing encryption key. If set, encryption will be enabled.

rocksdb.encryption-keyfolder.description: Folder containing all possible user encryption keys. All keys will be used to decrypt the internal keystore.

rocksdb.enforce-block-cache-size-limit.description: if true, strictly enforces the block cache size limit

rocksdb.exclusive-writes.description: if true, writes are exclusive. This allows the RocksDB engine to mimic the collection locking behavior of the now-removed MMFiles storage engine, but will inhibit concurrent write operations

rocksdb.format-version.description: table format version to use inside RocksDB

rocksdb.intermediate-commit-count.description: an intermediate commit will be performed automatically when this number of operations is reached in a transaction

rocksdb.intermediate-commit-size.description: an intermediate commit will be performed automatically when a transaction has accumulated operations of this size (in bytes)

rocksdb.level0-compaction-trigger.description: number of level-0 files that triggers a compaction

rocksdb.level0-slowdown-trigger.description: number of level-0 files that triggers a write slowdown

rocksdb.level0-stop-trigger.description: number of level-0 files that triggers a full write stop

rocksdb.limit-open-files-at-startup.description: limit the amount of .sst files RocksDB will inspect at startup, in order to reduce startup IO

rocksdb.max-background-jobs.description: Maximum number of concurrent background jobs (compactions and flushes)

rocksdb.max-bytes-for-level-base.description: if not using dynamic level sizes, this controls the maximum total data size for level-1

rocksdb.max-bytes-for-level-multiplier.description: if not using dynamic level sizes, the maximum number of bytes for level L can be calculated as  max-bytes-for-level-base * (max-bytes-for-level-multiplier ^ (L-1))

rocksdb.max-parallel-compactions.description: maximum number of parallel compactions jobs

rocksdb.max-subcompactions.description: maximum number of concurrent subjobs for a background compaction

rocksdb.max-total-wal-size.description: maximum total size of WAL files that will force flush stale column families

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number.description: maximum number of write buffers that build up in memory (default: number of column families + 2 = 9 write buffers). You can increase the amount only

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number-definiti.description: If non-zero, overrides the value of `--rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number` for the definitions column family

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number-document.description: If non-zero, overrides the value of `--rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number` for the documents column family

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number-edge.description: If non-zero, overrides the value of `--rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number` for the edge column family

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number-fulltext.description: If non-zero, overrides the value of `--rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number` for the fulltext column family

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number-geo.description: If non-zero, overrides the value of `--rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number` for the geo column family

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number-primary.description: If non-zero, overrides the value of `--rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number` for the primary column family

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number-replicat.description: If non-zero, overrides the value of `--rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number` for the replicated-logs column family

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number-vpack.description: If non-zero, overrides the value of `--rocksdb.max-write-buffer-number` for the vpack column family

rocksdb.max-write-buffer-size-to-maintai.description: maximum size of immutable write buffers that build up in memory per column family (larger values mean that more in-memory data can be used for transaction conflict checking (-1 = use automatic default value, 0 = do not keep immutable flushed write buffers, which is the default and usually correct))

rocksdb.min-write-buffer-number-to-merge.description: minimum number of write buffers that will be merged together before writing to storage

rocksdb.minimum-disk-free-bytes.description: minimum number of free disk bytes for considering the server healthy in health checks (set to 0 to disable the check)

rocksdb.minimum-disk-free-percent.description: minimum percentage of free disk space for considering the server healthy in health checks (set to 0 to disable the check)

rocksdb.num-levels.description: number of levels for the database

rocksdb.num-threads-priority-high.description: number of threads for high priority operations (e.g. flush)

rocksdb.num-threads-priority-low.description: number of threads for low priority operations (e.g. compaction)

rocksdb.num-uncompressed-levels.description: number of uncompressed levels for the database

rocksdb.optimize-filters-for-hits.description: this flag specifies that the implementation should optimize the filters mainly for cases where keys are found rather than also optimize for keys missed. This would be used in cases where the application knows that there are very few misses or the performance in the case of misses is not important

rocksdb.pending-compactions-slowdown-tri.description: number of pending compaction bytes that triggers a write slowdown

rocksdb.pending-compactions-stop-trigger.description: number of pending compaction bytes that triggers a full write stop

rocksdb.pin-l0-filter-and-index-blocks-i.description: if true and `--rocksdb.cache-index-and-filter-blocks` is also true, filter and index blocks are pinned and only evicted from cache when the table reader is freed

rocksdb.pin-top-level-index-and-filter.description: If true and `--rocksdb.cache-index-and-filter-blocks` is also true, the top-level index of partitioned filter and index blocks are pinned and only evicted from cache when the table reader is freed

rocksdb.recycle-log-file-num.description: if true, keep a pool of log files around for recycling

rocksdb.reserve-table-builder-memory.description: account for table building memory in block cache

rocksdb.reserve-table-reader-memory.description: account for table reader memory in block cache

rocksdb.sync-delay-threshold.description: threshold value for self-observation of WAL disk syncs. any WAL disk sync longer ago than this threshold will trigger a warning (in milliseconds, use 0 for no warnings)

rocksdb.sync-interval.description: interval for automatic, non-requested disk syncs (in milliseconds, use 0 to turn automatic syncing off)

rocksdb.table-block-size.description: approximate size (in bytes) of user data packed per block

rocksdb.target-file-size-base.description: Per-file target file size for compaction (in bytes). The actual target file size for each level is `--rocksdb.target-file-size-base` multiplied by `--rocksdb.target-file-size-multiplier` ^ (level - 1)

rocksdb.target-file-size-multiplier.description: multiplier for `--rocksdb.target-file-size`, a value of 1 means that files in different levels will have the same size

rocksdb.throttle-lower-bound-bps.description: lower bound for throttle's write bandwidth in bytes per second

rocksdb.throttle-max-write-rate.description: maximum write rate enforced by throttle (in bytes per second, 0 = unlimited)

rocksdb.throttle-scaling-factor.description: adaptiveness scaling factor for write-throttle calculations

rocksdb.throttle-slots.description: number of historic metrics to use for throttle value calculation

rocksdb.throttle-slow-down-writes-trigge.description: number of level 0 files whose payload is not considered in throttle calculations when penalizing the presence of L0 files

rocksdb.total-write-buffer-size.description: maximum total size of in-memory write buffers (0 = unbounded)

rocksdb.transaction-lock-stripes.description: Number of lock stripes to use for transaction locks

rocksdb.transaction-lock-timeout.description: If positive, specifies the wait timeout in milliseconds when  a transaction attempts to lock a document. A negative value is not recommended as it can lead to deadlocks (0 = no waiting, < 0 no timeout)

rocksdb.use-direct-io-for-flush-and-comp.description: use O_DIRECT for flush and compaction

rocksdb.use-file-logging.description: use a file-base logger for RocksDB's own logs

rocksdb.use-fsync.description: issue an fsync when writing to disk (set to true for issuing fdatasync only)

rocksdb.use-range-delete-in-wal.description: enable range delete markers in the write-ahead log (WAL). potentially incompatible with older arangosync versions

rocksdb.wal-archive-size-limit.description: maximum total size (in bytes) of archived WAL files (0 = unlimited)

rocksdb.wal-directory.description: optional path to the RocksDB WAL directory. If not set, the WAL directory will be located inside the regular data directory

rocksdb.wal-file-timeout.description: timeout after which unused WAL files are deleted

rocksdb.wal-file-timeout-initial.description: initial timeout after which unused WAL files deletion kicks in after server start

rocksdb.wal-recovery-skip-corrupted.description: skip corrupted records in WAL recovery

rocksdb.write-buffer-size.description: amount of data to build up in memory before converting to a sorted on-disk file (0 = disabled)

server.allow-use-database.description: allow change of database in REST actions, only needed for unittests

server.authentication.description: enable authentication for ALL client requests

server.authentication-system-only.description: use HTTP authentication only for requests to /_api and /_admin

server.authentication-timeout.description: timeout for the authentication cache in seconds (0 = indefinitely)

server.authentication-unix-sockets.description: authentication for requests via UNIX domain sockets

server.cluster-metrics-timeout.description: Cluster metrics polling timeout in seconds

server.descriptors-minimum.description: minimum number of file descriptors needed to start (0 = no minimum)

server.early-connections.description: allow requests to limited APIs early during server startup

server.export-metrics-api.description: turn metrics API on or off

server.export-read-write-metrics.description: turn metrics for document read/write metrics on or off

server.gid.description: switch to group-id after reading config files

server.harden.description: lock down REST APIs that reveal version information or server internals for non-admin users

server.io-threads.description: number of threads used to handle IO

server.jwt-secret.description: secret to use when doing jwt authentication

server.jwt-secret-folder.description: folder containing one or more jwt secret files to use for jwt authentication. Files are sorted alphabetically: First secret is used for signing + verifying JWT tokens. The latter secrets are only used for verifying.

server.jwt-secret-keyfile.description: file containing jwt secret to use when doing jwt authentication.

server.local-authentication.description: enable authentication using the local user database

server.maintenance-actions-block.description: minimum number of seconds finished Actions block duplicates

server.maintenance-actions-linger.description: minimum number of seconds finished Actions remain in deque

server.maintenance-slow-threads.description: maximum number of threads available for slow maintenance actions (long SynchronizeShard and long EnsureIndex)

server.maintenance-threads.description: maximum number of threads available for maintenance actions

server.maximal-threads.description: maximum number of request handling threads to run (0 = use system-specific default of 64)

server.minimal-threads.description: minimum number of request handling threads to run

server.ongoing-low-priority-multiplier.description: controls the number of low prio requests that can be ongoing at a given point in time, relative to the maximum number of request handling threads

server.scheduler-queue-size.description: number of simultaneously queued requests inside the scheduler

server.session-timeout.description: lifetime for tokens in seconds that can be obtained from the POST /_open/auth endpoint. Used by the web interface for JWT-based sessions

server.statistics.description: turn statistics gathering and APIs on or off

server.statistics-all-databases.description: provide cluster statistics in web interface in all databases

server.statistics-history.description: turn storing statistics in database on or off

server.storage-engine.description: storage engine type (note that the mmfiles engine is unavailable since v3.7.0 and cannot be used anymore)

server.support-info-api.description: policy for exposing support info API

server.uid.description: switch to user-id after reading config files

server.unavailability-queue-fill-grade.description: queue fill grade from which onwards the server is considered unavailable because of overload (ratio, use a value of 0 to disable it)

server.validate-utf8-strings.description: perform UTF-8 string validation for incoming JSON and VelocyPack data

ssl.cafile.description: ca file used for secure connections

ssl.cipher-list.description: ssl ciphers to use, see OpenSSL documentation

ssl.ecdh-curve.description: SSL ECDH Curve, see the output of "openssl ecparam -list_curves"

ssl.options.description: ssl connection options, see OpenSSL documentation

ssl.prefer-http1-in-alpn.description: Allows to let the server prefer HTTP/1.1 over HTTP/2 in ALPN protocol negotiations

ssl.protocol.description: ssl protocol (1 = SSLv2 (unsupported), 2 = SSLv2 or SSLv3 (negotiated), 3 = SSLv3, 4 = TLSv1, 5 = TLSv1.2, 6 = TLSv1.3, 9 = generic TLS)

ssl.require-peer-certificate.description: require a peer certificate when connecting

ssl.server-name-indication.description: add a case SERVERNAME=KEYFILENAME for a different server keyfile for a specific server name, can be given multiple times

ssl.session-cache.description: enable the session cache for connections

supervisor.description: background the server, starts a supervisor

temp.-intermediate-results-encryption-ha.description: use Intel intrinsics-based encryption, requiring a CPU with the AES-NI instruction set. If turned off, then OpenSSL is used, which may use hardware-accelarated encryption too.

temp.intermediate-results-capacity.description: maximum capacity (in bytes) to use for ephemeral, intermediate results on disk (0 = unlimited)

temp.intermediate-results-encryption.description: encrypt ephemeral, intermediate results on disk

temp.intermediate-results-path.description: path for ephemeral, intermediate results on disk (empty = not used)

temp.intermediate-results-spillover-thre.description: memory usage threshold after which a spillover to disk will happen for intermediate results (threshold per query executor)
number of result rows after which a spillover to disk will happen for intermediate results (threshold per query executor)

transaction.streaming-idle-timeout.description: idle timeout for streaming transactions in seconds

transaction.streaming-lock-timeout.description: lock timeout in seconds in case of parallel access to the same streaming transaction

ttl.frequency.description: frequency (in milliseconds) for the TTL background thread invocation. a value of 0 turns the TTL background thread off entirely

ttl.max-collection-removes.description: maximum number of documents to remove per collection

ttl.max-total-removes.description: maximum number of documents to remove per invocation of the TTL thread

uid.description: switch to user-id after reading config files

version-json.description: reports the version as JSON and exits

web-interface.trusted-proxy.description: List of proxies to trust (can be IP or network). Make sure `--web-interface.proxy-request-check` is enabled.

web-interface.version-check.description: alert the user if new versions are available
